item.title: WAF Managed Rules
item.description: Configure WAF Managed RulesThis page provides examples of deploying and configuring WAF Managed Rules in your zone or account using Terraform. It covers the following configurations: Deploy managed rulesets Configure skip rules Configure payload logging Configure overrides Configure the OWASP paranoia level, score threshold, and action For more information on WAF Managed Rules, refer to Managed Rules in the Cloudflare WAF documentation. For more information on deploying and configuring rulesets using the Rulesets API, refer to Work with managed rulesets in the Ruleset Engine documentation.

item.title: DDoS managed rulesets
item.description: Configure DDoS managed rulesetsThis page provides examples of configuring DDoS managed rulesets in your zone or account using Terraform. It covers the following configurations: Configure HTTP DDoS Attack Protection Configure Network-layer DDoS Attack Protection DDoS managed rulesets are always enabled. Depending on your Cloudflare services, you may be able to adjust their behavior. For more information on DDoS managed rulesets, refer to Managed rulesets in the Cloudflare DDoS Protection documentation.

item.title: WAF custom rules
item.description: Configure WAF custom rulesThis page provides examples of creating WAF custom rules in a zone or account using Terraform. The examples cover the following scenarios: Zone-level configurations: Add a custom rule to a zone Account-level configurations: Create and deploy a custom ruleset Add a custom rule checking for exposed credentials For more information on custom rules, refer to Custom rules in the Cloudflare WAF documentation. ​​ Zone-level configurations ​​ Add a custom rule to a zone The following example configures a custom rule in the zone entry point ruleset for the http_request_firewall_custom phase for zone with ID <ZONE_ID>.

item.title: Transform Rules
item.description: Configure Transform RulesThis page provides examples of creating Transform Rules in a zone using Terraform.
